title: Portrait of Don Ramón Satué
titles: Portrait of Don Ramón Satué y Allué (1765-1824)
Don Ramón Satué (1765-1824). Alcalde de Corte (Judge of the Fifth Chamber of the Council of Castile in La Corte)
description: Portret van Don Ramón Satué. Lid van de Sala de Alcaldes de Corte per la Audiencia Territorial de Madrid. Heupstuk, naar links, staande met de handen in de zakken.
plaqueDescriptionDutch: Goya dankt zijn faam aan zijn portretten van het Spaanse hof en zijn eigenaardige prentenkunst. Hij was al 76 jaar oud toen hij dit krachtige portret schilderde. Don Ramón was rechter bij het hoogste gerechtshof van CastiÏië. Door de ontspannen houding en open kraag maakt het portret een informele indruk. Daarom is het te rangschikken onder Goyas portretten van zijn meest intieme vrienden.
plaqueDescriptionEnglish: Goya was well-known as a court-painter and for his idiosyncratic prints. He had already turned 76 when he painted this powerful portrait. Don Ramón was a judge in the highest tribunal of Castile. The casual pose and open collar have an informality Goya usually reserves for the portraits of his most intimate friends.

acquisition.creditLine: Purchased with the support of the Vereniging Rembrandt

longTitle: Portrait of Don Ramón Satué, Francisco de Goya, 1823
subTitle: h 107cm × w 83.5cm
scLabelLine: Francisco José de Goya y Lucientes (1746-1828), oil on canvas, 1823

label.title: Portrait of Don Ramón Satué
label.makerLine: Francisco José de Goya y Lucientes (1746-1828), oil on canvas, 1823
label.description: Goya owes his fame to his portraits of the Spanish court and to his idiosyncratic prints. He had already turned 76 when he painted this powerful portrait. Satué was a judge in the highest tribunal of Castile. The casual pose and open collar have an informality that Goya usually reserved for portraits of his most intimate friends.
